Other writers identified the 'ancients' and 'moderns' more precisely than de Bury. The term antiqui could designate the 'ancient' writers of Greco-Latin antiquity as opposed to 'modern' Christians, or the 'ancient' Church Fathers as opposed to 'modern' medieval writers, or those 'ancient' men who lived before the advent of Christ as opposed to those 'modern' men who live after it
